questions.question: Before starting an investigation or lab procedure, you should:

choices.answer: try an experiment of your own
read all directions & make sure you understand them
open all containers & packages
handle all equipment to become familiar with it

questions.question: When pouring chemicals between containers, you should hold the containers over:

choices.answer: the floor or a waste basket
an eyewash station or a water fountain
a fire blanket or an oven mitt
a sink or your work area

questions.question: If you get hurt or injured in any way, you should:

choices.answer: tell your teacher immediately
go to the principal's office
find bandages or a first aid kit
get help after you finish the lab

questions.question: If your glassware is chipped or broken, you should:

choices.answer: use it only for solid materials
put it back into the storage cabinet
give it to your teacher for recycling or disposal
increase the damage so that it is obvious

questions.question: If you have unused chemicals after finishing a procedure, you should:

choices.answer: pour them down a sink or drain
put them back into their original containers
mix them all together in a bucket
dispose of them as directed by your teacher

questions.question: If electrical equipment has a frayed cord, you should:

choices.answer: unplug the equipment by pulling on the cord
tell your teacher about the problem immediately
let the cord hang over the side of a counter or table
wrap tape around the cord to repair it

questions.question: If you need to determine the odor of a chemical or a solution, you should:

choices.answer: use your hand to bring fumes from the container to your nose
tell your teacher immediately
bring the container under your nose and inhale deeply
use odor-sensing equipment

questions.question: What do you need when working with materials that might fly into the air?

choices.answer: goggles
gloves
an apron
a hat

questions.question: Before doing experiments involving a heat source, you should know the location of the:

choices.answer: door
fire extinguisher
windows
overhead lights

questions.question: When working with a flame or a heat source, you should:

choices.answer: tie back long hair
touch an object with our bare hand to see how hot it is
heat substances or objects inside a closed container
throw hot objects into the trash when you are done with them

questions.question: If a beaker of water falls to the floor and breaks, you should:

choices.answer: continue working
tell your teacher about the accident
carefully pick up and dispose of the glass
mop up the water

questions.question: Which is the following is an important step in maintaining lab and personal hygiene?

choices.answer: wash your hands thoroughly before leaving the lab
use tongs or protective gloves to handle heated objects
notify your teacher immediately if glassware breaks
do not leave a hotplate unattended while it is switched on

questions.question: What should you NOT do if your clothing catches fire?

choices.answer: call out for your teacher's & lab partner's attention
drop to the floor and roll over
run to the sink as fast as you can
cover your face with your hands

questions.question: Which of the following would be called an unauthorized experiment?

choices.answer: one that uses objects you collected
one that includes procedures not approved by your teacher
one you designed yourself with the approval of your teacher
one found in your lab manual

questions.question: Why is horseplay not allowed in the lab?

choices.answer: animals are not permitted in the lab
lab equipment can cause injury if misused
science is a serious subject with no room for creativity
free expression or experimentation are not a part of science

questions.question: Why should you never work alone in the lab?

choices.answer: it gets very lonely working by yourself
teachers do not like students to pursue independent inquiry
if an accident happens, there is no one to turn to for help
science discourages the creativity of individuals
